thread.title: Iranian Oil Squeeze Could Upset OPEC Agreement on Production Cuts

author: Georgi Kantchev
title: Iranian Oil Squeeze Could Upset OPEC Agreement on Production Cuts
text:
President Donald Trump’s decision to withdraw from the Iran nuclear deal could pile pressure on OPEC’s pact to limit production and upset the delicate balance among its disparate signatories, analysts say.
Oil prices hit 3½-year highs this week amid expectations that renewed U.S. economic sanctions will squeeze Iran’s oil supply and escalate regional tensions that have the potential to further limit the flow of crude.
But... RELATED VIDEO Will Trump's Iran Bet Pay Off? After President Donald Trump's big gamble to pull the U.S. out of the Iran nuclear deal, the focus now shifts to Tehran, the Iranian people and America's allies. Gerald F. Seib explains the high stakes. Photo: Getty
